channel.title: Comments on: Windows Server 2008 R2 Failover Clustering: It’s Cool
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: jhenriksen
item.dc:creator: jhenriksen
item.description:
We are thinking of moving to a virtual environment with our 3 physical node sql 2008 R2 cluster. Basically, we would have one physical node and 2 vm5 nodes. Have you had any experience with running sql server in a vm environment? If so, are there any I/O issues from a physical to a vm5?
Any guidance would be appreciated!
Thanks,
Jeremy Henriksen
item.content:encoded:
We are thinking of moving to a virtual environment with our 3 physical node sql 2008 R2 cluster. Basically, we would have one physical node and 2 vm5 nodes. Have you had any experience with running sql server in a vm environment? If so, are there any I/O issues from a physical to a vm5?

Any guidance would be appreciated!

Thanks,

Jeremy Henriksen

item.title: By: Amanda
item.dc:creator: Amanda
item.content:encoded:
Hi Jes,
So, most of my environments are flaky. I’m looking at my dual-node 2008 R2 cluster, and one node has a PaxosTag of blah:57 (active node) and the other has a PaxosTag of blah:60.

Is this expected?

Is there a list somewhere of what *should* be the same on a SQL Server registry?

Amanda
